column4: ok, since no one has any useful advice for me, I have a general question. why does ubuntu by default make filesystems mount read-only on error, if X and everything else utterly fails when / is read-only?
I mean, wouldn't it make sense to at least mount /tmp in ram, so you could do *something*? livecds manage just fine without a writable disk
feel free to propose it via brainstorm/blueprint
I suppose I'll do that... if I get my system working again
